channel.title: CyberNetSec - Security Operations
channel.description: Latest security operations threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: FBI Shuts Down RAMP, a Notorious Ransomware Recruitment and Trading Hub
item.description:
In a significant blow to the ransomware ecosystem, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has seized the RAMP (Russian Anonymous MarketPlace) forum. The Russian-language site, which operated on both the clear and dark web, was a central hub for ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operations. It s...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
item.description:
IT services giant Cognizant Technology Solutions is facing multiple class-action lawsuits in the U.S. following a significant data breach at its healthcare subsidiary, TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS). The lawsuits, filed in New Jersey and Missouri, allege that Cognizant failed to adequately protec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: Industry Responds to Threats with New Tools for Supply Chain, AI, and Malware Analysis
item.description:

item.title: Microsoft Issues Emergency Out-of-Band Patches for Flawed January Updates
item.description:
Microsoft has released several emergency out-of-band (OOB) updates on January 24, 2026, to address significant bugs introduced by its January 13 Patch Tuesday release. The faulty updates caused a range of issues, including Remote Desktop connection failures, application hangs when accessing cloud st...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Security Operations

item.title: 'Skeleton Key' Attacks Bypass Defenses by Weaponizing Legitimate RMM Tools
item.description:
A sophisticated attack campaign dubbed "Skeleton Key" is bypassing traditional, malware-focused security defenses by weaponizing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. A report from KnowBe4 Threat Labs details how attackers first compromise user credentials and then abuse truste...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Security Operations, Cyberattack

item.title: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact
item.description:
A new survey by specialty insurer AXIS Capital, released on January 20, 2026, reveals a significant perception gap between CEOs and CISOs regarding the role of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity. While CEOs are largely optimistic about AI's productivity and security benefits, CISOs are more ac...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations, Other

item.title: NSA Kickstarts Zero Trust Adoption with New Foundational Implementation Guides
item.description:
The U.S. National Security Agency (NSA) has released the first two documents in its new Zero Trust Implementation Guidelines (ZIGs) series. The 'Primer' and 'Discovery Phase' guides are designed to provide federal agencies and other organizations with a foundational roadmap for adopting a Zero Trust...

Severity: Informational

item.title: ColorTokens Xshield Platform Gains FedRAMP Moderate Authorization, Boosting Federal Zero Trust Adoption
item.description:
ColorTokens has achieved FedRAMP Moderate Authorization for its Xshield microsegmentation platform, a significant milestone that makes the solution readily available to U.S. federal agencies via the FedRAMP Marketplace. item.description:

item.title: SpyCloud Unveils Supply Chain Threat Protection to Combat Third-Party Identity Risks
item.description:
